title: Whole Lotta Yoga Houston at Levy Park
address: 3801 Eastside Houston , TX 77098 United States
body: Join all your favorite local yoga studios at Levy Park for Whole Lotta Yoga, a one-day festival highlighting the best of Houston yoga and benefiting Whole Planet Foundation. Admission Tickets range from $20 to $50.

title: Seasonal Fermented Vegetable Workshop at Finca Tres Robles
address: 257 N Greenwood St Houston , TX 77011 United States
body: In this introductory class, you'll learn the basics of the fermentation process, taste homemade ferments, and make and take home a mason jar of your first vegetable ferment. Admission Tickets are $30.

title: Kids 1st Saturday at The Breakfast Klub
address: 3711 Travis at Alabama Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Bring the kiddos over to The Breakfast Klub restaurant for a morning featuring a moonwalk, a face painter, arts & crafts, and kid-friendly entertainment. Admission Free to attend.

title: First Saturday Arts Market in The Heights
address: 540 West 19th St Houston, TX 77008 United States
body: Browse fine art and eclectic goods at the free monthly First Saturday Arts Market in the heart of the Houston Heights. In addition to shopping and browsing, you’ll find live music, food truck bites, great people watching and more. Admission: Free to attend.

title: Oktoberfest 2017 at Saint Arnold Brewing Company
address: 2000 Lyons Ave Houston, TX 77020 United States
body: Put on your best dirndl, lederhosen or other Tyrolean duds and head to Saint Arnold’s annual Oktoberfest party. Have some German-inspired food, beer, and join in on the Oktoberfest festivities beginning at 5pm. You could even be crowned King or Queen of Oktoberfest – they’ll have a contest to see who comes outfitted the best. Admission: No cover. For $15, you can get the 20 oz commemorative mug and a 20 oz beer.

title: Caturday Morning Cartoons at El Gato Coffeehouse
address: 508 Pecore St, Suite A Houston , TX 77009 United States
body: Spend a lazy Saturday morning watching cat-themed cartoons from the ’90s at this family-friendly event El Gato Coffeehouse Cat Cafe. Admission Tickets are $10 an hour for kids ages 5 to 17; $12 an hour with a student ID; $14 an hour for adults.

title: Fifth Ward Fall Festival
address: 3215 Lyons Ave Houston , TX 77020 United States
body: Bring the whole family for this Fall-themed festival with the Fifth Ward community and enjoy kids activities, vendors and more. Admission This event is free to attend.

title: 6th Annual King’s Oktoberfest Weekend at King’s Biergarten in Pearland
address: 1329 E Broadway Street Pearland, TX 77581 United States
body: King’s annual Oktoberfest celebration returns with more live German music, more biers, more brats, and more fun. Admission starts at $12.

title: International Bacon Fest at HTX Sports Creek
address: 2619 Polk St Houston , TX 77003 United States
body: The International Bacon Fest, or Bacon iFest for short, will feature bacon and pork-inspired dishes from around the world. There'll be dishes from Latin America, Asia, the Caribbean, Canada, and the United States. Expect plenty of tastings, as well as carnival rides, live music, a bacon-eating competition, games, crafts, a pig pen, and more. Admission starts at $10.

title: Stephen F. Austin University Lumberjacks vs. Sam Houston State Bearkats at NRG Stadium
address: Reliant Pkwy Houston, TX 77054 United States
body: Touted as the oldest college football rivalry, the 92nd Battle of the Piney Woods comes to NRG Stadium. Admission Tickets range from $15 up to $43.

title: RGFF Charity Pub Crawl with The Suffers in Concert
address: 801 St. Emanuel St Houston, TX 77003 United States
body: Begin the RGFF Charity Pub Crawl at Lucky's Pub, make your way to other bars in EaDo, and then head back to Lucky's Pub to end the evening with a concert by The Suffers. This charity pub crawl benefits the Robert Garner Firefighter Foundation. Admission General admission starts at $25 and includes 5 Karbach beers.

title: Stop, Look and Listen! at The Menil Collection
address: 1533 Sul Ross St Houston, TX 77006 United States
body: Da Camera presents Stop, Look and Listen!, a free chamber music and jazz concert at The Menil Collection. Admission Free to attend.

title: Shop Local Market at Sigma Brewing Company
address: 3118 Harrisburg Blvd #108 Houston , TX 77003 United States
body: Shop Local, a Vintage and Arts Market sets up at Sigma Brewing Company for an evening of vendors, food trucks, art and live music. Admission No cover.

title: Grito Fest 2017 in Baytown
address: 1001 Market St. Baytown, TX United States
body: Grito Fest 2017 features music by Fito Olivares, Grupo Alcanzable and more as well as a jalapeño eating contest and an accordion contest at Bicentennial Park in Baytown. Admission This event is free to attend.

title: Karbachtoberfest at Karbach Brewing Co.
address: 2032 Karbach St Houston, TX 77092 United States
body: Celebrate Karbachtoberfest with four weekends of festivities, a German inspired menu, beer, live performances by Blaze X Black and more. Admission: Free to Attend.

title: Ryan Adams in Concert at Revention Music Center
address: 520 Texas St Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Catch the singer-songwriter Ryan Adams play songs off of his new record Prisoner B-Sides at Revention Music Center. Admission Tickets start at $35.

title: Halloween Movie Nights at Galveston Island Historic Pleasure Pier
address: 2501 Seawall Blvd Galveston, TX 77550 United States
body: Bring the family to the Pleasure Pier in Galveston for their Halloween-themed movie series happening throughout October. Schedule  Saturday, October 7 – Monster House Saturday, October 14 – The Haunted Mansion Saturday, October 21 – Hotel Transylvania  Saturday, October 28 – Hocus Pocus  Admission Cover charge at the door.

title: 39th Anniversary Party at Numbers Nightclub
address: 300 Westheimer Houston, TX 77006 United States
body: Celebrate 39 years of the iconic Montrose venue and dance club, Numbers Nightclub with giveaways, Numbers t-shirts, lifetime passes, and of course, lots of dancing. Admission Cover charge at the door.

title: Pachanguear con Bombón at Fox Hollow
address: 4617 Nett Street Houston, TX 77007 United States
body: The Houston DJ collective, Bombón hosts a dance night of all Latin music to benefit the victims of the earthquake in Mexico and Hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico at Fox Hollow. Admission Suggested donation is $10.

title: The Late Show at Prohibition Supperclub & Bar
address: 1008 Prairie Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Step into the Roaring 20s, when skirts were short and booze was a secret pleasure. The Moonlight Dolls and special guests perform classic and tasteful stripteases, plus vocalists, dancers, and aerialists showcasing their signature acts. Admission: Tickets are 40$.
